artciles.q: A soil sample may be well graded if:
option: If it has most number of particles of same size
Good representation of particles of all size
artciles.answer: Good representation of particles of all size
artciles.description: A soil is said to be well graded when it has a good representation of particle of all size.

artciles.q: For coarse grained soil, the particle size D10 is sometimes called as
artciles.description: The size D10 is sometimes called as the effective size or effective diameter.

artciles.q: The shape of particle size curve, which is represented by the coefficient of curvature (Cc) is given by
artciles.description: The coefficient of curvature (Cc) is given by the equation Cc = (D40)2/D10×D30.

artciles.q: The curve situated at the right side of the particle size distribution curve is
artciles.description: The right side the particle size distribution curve shows the coarse-grained while the left shows the relatively fine-grained soil.

artciles.q: The coefficient of uniformity (CV) is the ratio of
artciles.description: The coefficient of uniformity CV, is defined as the ratio of D60 and D10 i.e.CV = D60/ D10.

artciles.q: What is the time of settlement of coarse particle of a soil sample, of diameter 0.5? Take γ=0.905D2 and height of water tank as 5 m.
artciles.description: γ=0.905(0.5)2=0.2263 m/sec. Time of settlement, T=h/v =5/0.2263=22.1 seconds.

artciles.q: A curve with a flat portion, in particle size distribution curve represent
artciles.description: A curve with a flat portion represents oil in which intermediate size particle are missing.

artciles.q: The D10 represents a size, such that _________ of the particles are finer than this size.
artciles.description: The D10 represents a size, in mm such that 10% of the particle is finer than D10 size.

artciles.q: The time of settlement of the finest particle of soil sample is 15hr20min49sec. calculate the height of the water tank. Take D=0.01 mm, γ=0.905D2.
The shape of the particle size curve is represented by
artciles.description: Coefficient of the curvature Cc represent the shape of the particle size curve given by CC= (D40)2/D10×D30.

artciles.q: A particle-size distribution curve gives us an idea about
artciles.description: A particle-size curve shows both type and gradation of the soil.

artciles.q: In sedimentation analysis, the soil fraction should be of what micron size, so as to be kept in a liquid medium (water).
artciles.description: According to Indian standards the soil fraction is set as 75 microns to be used in a liquid medium.

artciles.q: The sedimentation analysis is done with the help of
artciles.description: Both the hydrometer and pipette method can be used for taking sedimentation analysis.

artciles.q: The time for a particle to settle, of diameter 0.06 through a height of 10 cm is
artciles.description: Based on the time of settlement of particles of various diameters it is found that minimum time of 25.8 s is needed for a particle to settle of diameter 0.006 mm.

artciles.q: Which of the following assumptions is wrong, with respect to sedimentation analysis?
option: Particle settle independent of other particles do not have any effect on its velocity of settlements
Soil particles has different specific gravity
artciles.answer: Soil particles has different specific gravity
artciles.description: In sedimentation analysis, soil particle has average specific gravity.

artciles.q: The sedimentation analysis is based on _________ law.
artciles.description: The sedimentation analysis is based on stokes law according to which the velocity at which the grains settles down depend on shape, size, weight of grain.

artciles.q: In the formula, f=105√(300 ɳ/(g-1)Vw), the factor ɳ depends on
artciles.description: Since ɳ=viscosity of water/liquid, it can be affected by temperature.

artciles.q: The lower limit of particle size allowed in sedimentation analysis is
artciles.description: The particle smaller than 0.0002 mm is affected by Brownian movement and stokes law remains no longer valid.

artciles.q: 1 poise is equivalent to
artciles.description: As,1 poise =1/10 NS/ m2 so 1 poise =0.1 NS/ m2.

artciles.q: The unit weight of water in v=(2/g)r2(Vs-Vw/ɳ) is taken as
artciles.description: The constant value of unit weight of water/liquid is taken as γw=9.81 kn/m2.

artciles.q: Viscosity of water/liquid (ɳ) is expressed in
artciles.description: The viscosity of distilled water in sedimentation analysis is taken as 0.00855 KN-s/m2.

artciles.q: In consistency of soil, the limits are expressed in terms of
artciles.description: According to Atterberg, the consistency limits are expressed as percent water content.

artciles.q: The ratio of liquid limit, minus the natural water content to the plasticity index of the soil is
artciles.description: consistency index or relative consistency is defined as the ratio of liquid limit, minus the natural water content to the plasticity index of the soil.

artciles.q: The property of a soil which allows it to be deformed rapidly, without rupture is
artciles.description: Plasticity is the property of a soil which allows it to be deformed rapidly, without rupture, without elastic rebound and without volume change.

artciles.q: Clay does not become plastic, when mixed with
artciles.description: According to Goldschmidt theory, the clay does not become plastic when mixed with liquids of non-polarizing agents like kerosene.
